zebrogamq.gamelogic
Class OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions

java.lang.Object
  zebrogamq.gamelogic.OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions
Direct Known Subclasses:
NOpOptionalDelegationOfStandardActions
public abstract class OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions
extends java.lang.Object

This class should be extended to implement a special behaviour on the reception of basic actions: join actions, lifecycle actions and presence actions. Indeed, when users receive a JOIN or a JOIN_OK message,the default behaviour is just to display a message. If you want to define your own behavior on the reception of such messages (by example to store the list of players), you should extend this class. Once you get your own implementation of this class in your application, you need to call the method OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions.setInstance() on an instance of your class. Doing so, when you will receive messages matching with the basic actions, it will be your own methods that will be called.

setInstance

public static void setInstance(OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions inst)
Replace the default NOpOptionalDelegationOfStandardActions class available by another class extending OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions. This method MUST be called if you want to use the method defined in your own class rather than those of used by default.

Parameters:
inst - an instance of a class extending OptionalDelegationOfStandardActions.

                               java.lang.String body)
Method called once the client receive a TERMINATE message.

Parameters:
state - the GameLogicState of the game logic
header - an array containing four informations about the message - the sender - the recipient - the action kind - the action
body - the content of the message
